text.p: Spanish electrical group Hidrocantabrico is studying the purchase of 91 percent of Electra de Viesgo, which is currently in the hands of Endesa, according to a local newspaper report on Monday.
Hidrocantabrico may also purchase Saltos del Nansa, the report said.

Sixty-six percent state-owned Endesa's offer to buy up to 75 percent of Sevillana and Fuerzas Electricas de Catalunya will require it sell some current holdings, likely in Viesgo, Nansa and Union Fenosa.
The paper said Hicrocantabrico could end up with a controlling stake in Saltos del Nansa, helping create a fourth electric group as the sector is radically reshaped.
The groupwould in this case follow the newly strengthened Endesa, Iberdrola, and Union Fenosa in ranking in terms of size.
